messages.message:
i think `converse-project-crud` sometimes fails in CI bc it assumes that there exists another Converse project besides the one being edited and deleted

however, itâ€™s possible that a different CI run deleted all other Converse projects (example run from Xindi's PR (https://cloud.cypress.io/projects/cfhedy/runs/9755/test-results?actions=%5B%5D&browsers=%5B%5D&groups=%5B%5D&isFlaky=%5B%5D&modificationDateRange=%7B%22startDate%22%3A%221970-01-01%22%2C%22endDate%22%3A%222038-01-19%22%7D&orderBy=EXECUTION_ORDER&oses=%5B%5D&specs=%5B%7B%22label%22%3A%22apps%2Fsrc%2Faihub%2F__e2e__%2FConverseApp%2Fconverse-project-crud.spec.ts%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5B%5C%226dcbc556-e955-458c-8a97-2739f7368ccf%5C%22%5D%22%7D%5D&statuses=%5B%5D&testingTypesEnum=%5B%5D)), so after deleting the current project, the user gets redirected to the AI Hub homepage, instead of going to the first Converse project that still exists

cc @Xindi Xu @Aayush @Subash

Took a look at this test - yes looks like the issue is assuming there's exists another converse project which may or may not be true - I'll take a look!
I thought I resolved all the concurrency issues in this PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/57105), but you never know :sweat_smile:.
